course.title: American Constitutional Law
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 1–2:30, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: Provides an introduction to contemporary American constitutional law, with a principal focus on decisions by the Supreme Court of the US. Topics to be studied include freedom of speech and religion, guarantees of due process and equal protection, and the powers of Congress and the courts.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for Ethical Reasoning.
